p: Saponins are another class of natural compounds that merit further study for their anti-trichomonad properties in rodents and humans. de Groot and MÃ¼ller-Goymann [ 50] confirmed that saponins such as digitonin and tomatine interact strongly with model membranes as well as natural membranes of erythrocytes, suggesting that their anti-trichomonad effect might involve disruption of the T. vaginalis cell membrane.
